sentences.sContent: She held the money tightly in her fist.
sentences.sCn: 她把钱紧紧地攥在手中。

sentences.sContent: Malcolm clenched his fist (= held his fist very tightly closed ) angrily.
sentences.sCn: 马尔科姆愤怒地握紧拳头。

sentences.sContent: Dooley stood up and shook his fist in her face.
sentences.sCn: 杜利站起身，在她眼前挥舞着拳头。

sentences.sContent: Varney slammed his fist down onto the table so hard the dishes jumped.
sentences.sCn: 瓦尼一拳砸在桌子上，盘子都给震了起来。

phrases.pCn: 平稳快捷地；[口]不费力地；[口]（尤指钱）大量地

trans.tranCn: 拳，拳头；〈口〉笔迹；掌握；[印]指标参见号
trans.tranOther: the hand when it is tightly closed, so that the fingers are curled in towards the  palm  . People close their hand in a fist when they are angry or are going to hit someone.
